snippet: Mayor Rahm Emanuel said he will propose an ordinance that would bar the police from turning over illegal immigrants to federal agents if they do not have criminal convictions.
abstract: Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel says he will propose an ordinance that would bar the police from turning over illegal immigrants to federal agents if they do not have criminal convictions or outstanding criminal warrants; proposal is latest challenge to Obama administration's immigration policies.

byline.original: By JULIA PRESTON and STEVEN YACCINO
byline.contributor: Julia Preston reported from New York, and Steven Yaccino from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Mayor Rahm Emanuel said he will propose an ordinance that would bar the police from turning over illegal immigrants to federal agents if they do not have criminal convictions.

headline.seo: Obama Policy on Illegal Immigrants Is Challenged by Chicago
headline.main: Obama Policy on Immigrants Is Challenged by Chicago
headline.print_headline: Obama Policy On Immigrants Is Challenged By Chicago
